item.title: Implement a RPC Protocol in C++
item.description: RTL8852AE is a network card model that Lenovo's notebook and desktop computers like to use. RTL8852AE+AX201 provides Wi-Fi 6 experience. However, because this set of things is relatively new, the driver has not been incorporated into the kernel, so it needs to compile the kernel module to support it.
item.content:encoded:
RTL8852AE is a network card model that Lenovo's notebook and desktop computers like to use. RTL8852AE+AX201 provides Wi-Fi 6 experience. However, because this set of things is relatively new, the driver has not been incorporated into the kernel, so it needs to compile the kernel module to support it.

Actually, the developer of RealTek has submitted the driver patch to Linux, but the code has not been incorporated into the kernel. Look at this patch https://lwn.net/ml/Linux-wireless/202012301527.izlr86em-lkp @ intel.com/ https://patches.linaro.org/cover/463567/

You can see that the folder rtw89 does not exist in the kernel. This folder should be/drivers/net/wireless/realtek/RTW 89. https://elixir.bootlin.com/linux/v5.15-rc6/source/drivers/net/wireless/realtek

Good people in the community have changed rtw89 v5 to dkms kernel module. https://github.com/lwfinger/rtw89

By following the README of rtw89, a kernel module can be compiled and installed in the system.

The solution is the simplest in arch system, and the warehouse rtw89-dkms-git already exists in AUR.

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.
item.content:encoded:
Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

  • 2019-05-30-welcome.md
  • 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

The blog supports tags as well!

And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

item.title: Long Blog Post
item.description: This is the summary of a very long blog post,
item.content:encoded:
This is the summary of a very long blog post,

Use a <!-- truncate --> comment to limit blog post size in the list view.
